alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Franklin; Ohio; Ripley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, FRANKLIN, RIPLEY AND DEARBORN COUNTIES THROUGH 1100 PM EDT... At 1000 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near North Vernon, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Batesville, Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Aurora, Brookville, Rising Sun, Bright, Hidden Valley, Versailles, Milan, Osgood, Dillsboro, Oldenburg, Moores Hill, Lake Santee, Guilford, Wilmington, Logan, Manchester and Blooming Grove. This includes the following Interstates... I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 145 and 171. I-74 in Ohio near mile marker 0. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
